text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with miso-glazed black cod that's
right i'm gonna show you my take on
Nobu's famous fish dish and i don't want
you to make this because it's absolutely
beautiful and incredibly delicious I
want you to make this because it's
Robert De Niro's favorites and how do I
know that I hear things but also I want
you to make it because it's so
unbelievably easy as you're about to see
so what we're gonna do is we're gonna
take a small pan and into that I'm going
to pour a couple tablespoons of water
and then a nice big spoon of white miso
and of course it's called white miso
because it's gold so I'm not quite sure
why this is called white miso but I do
know that it is a fermented soybean
paste and unbelievably delicious we're
also gonna sweeten this up a little bit
with some brown sugar but not nearly as
much as in most of the recipes you're
gonna see alright we're gonna go a
little closer to the authentic Japanese
version and not make it too sweet and
after the sugar we're gonna go ahead and
add some mirin which apparently is a
Swedish Japanese cooking wine although I
don't believe the one I'm using has any
alcohol in it but a splash of mirin and
then last but not least some sake which
is Japanese rice wine
so splash of that and at that point
we're gonna go over to the stove and
place this on medium heat and we'll give
that a stir as it warms up and then miso
paste will kind of dissolve although it
doesn't ever really get smooth I guess
you can strain it if you want but I
never do doesn't seem to make any
difference on the final product but
anyway go ahead and whisk that up as
smooth as you can and what we want to do
here is heat this until it starts
bubbling and then I'm just gonna cook
this for about a minute or two just to
slightly thicken it and by the way
that's why we add the water cuz I did
want to cook this for a couple minutes
to kind of meld everything together and
if you don't have the water after a
couple minutes it might be too thick but
anyway like I said we're gonna cook that
for a couple minutes until it looks like
this at that point simply turn off the
heat and let it cool completely we don't
want to put our hot glaze on our cold
fish so it's best if you go ahead and
make this ahead of time but anyway let
that cool down and at that point it's
ready to go on our black cod and there
it is
we have two black cod fillets that I've
laid down a lightly greased aluminum
foil also known as sable fish also known
as butter fish and if you do end up
making this you'll know why and I should
point out black cod doesn't come boned
it's always gonna have this little Ridge
of pinbones ago
right along there don't try to remove
them you'll tear up the fish those are
super super easy to pull out when this
is cooked you'll see
okay so ignore the bones for now and at
that point we're gonna go ahead and take
our now cooled miso glaze and very
liberally brush it all over all right we
want complete coverage including sides
of fronts backs etc and by the ways I'm
brushing this glaze on I'm reminded no
fish feels as sexy is black cod I mean I
really can't explain that it just has a
beautiful feel you can see how it's kind
of quivering under that brush it's very
provocative but any we're gonna brush
that on thoroughly and then what we're
gonna do is we're gonna leave this out
on the counter for about 15-20 minutes
at room temperature to give it sort of a
quick marinade now traditionally this
fish is left in the marinade for up to
24 hours but I actually prefer the quick
marinade better so for me this provides
maximum miso enjoyment but you decide
you are the Richard Blais of your glaze
but anyway to summarize we're gonna coat
that very thoroughly and we're gonna
leave it out for about 15 or 20 minutes
before we broil it which really is the
secret to why this is so amazing so
we're gonna head back over to the stove
we're gonna preheat our broiler on high
and then here's a little trick I use you
see that cupcake pan so my top racks too
high my middle racks too low so by using
a pan here I gonna get the perfect
height so anyway that's my system but
you want to be about seven or eight
inches under the heats and all we're
gonna do is broil at for about 10
minutes until it's cooked through and I
do about halfway like to go in and turn
the pan around generally most home
broilers are gonna have hot spots so I
like to turn it so it cooks evenly
so that was after about five minutes and
then after the turn I gave it four or
five more minutes and when I pulled it
out it looked like that which I thought
was super gorgeous and you can see in
this shot right here why I said not to
tear up the fish trying to pull those
bones out when your fish is cooked
through those will pull out super easy
in fact that's like a built-in doneness
indicator Thank You black cod alright so
right when this comes out of the broiler
before you put it on the plate go ahead
and pull out all those bones so
basically the eight to ten minutes under
the broiler is a pure gas alright you
know the drill you're gonna check in
these seams to see if it's flaking if it
flakes apart you're ready and I really
push the envelope I'd like to have my
just barely flaking barely cooked and
another reason you're gonna love this
recipe you don't have to let anything
rest let's go ahead and pop that on the
plate and eat as you can see I serve
mine super simply with some sugar snap
peas I tossed with
sesame oil just nice and light I don't
want anything competing or trying to
outshine the fish so I'm sorry this is
not gonna go well on your slim jim fried
rice and as I go in for a bite here you
have to watch for the juices check this
out it's like a river have you ever seen
a juicier piece of fish in your life and
don't even get me started on the flavor
it's just incredible alright little bit
sweet a little bit tart just the right
amount of that fermented funkiness from
the miso just an absolutely brilliant
combination of sauce and fish and to
people that say you don't like fish you
don't like dry fishy tasty and horribly
prepared fish you like this trust me
everybody likes this so I really do hope
you give that a try
head over to food whooshes calm for all
